message: For the Shadow!

replies.text: Fight

message: Good to hear that there are at least a few people left out there willing to take a stand against Feygard.
Should you really be out here all by yourself?
Look fellas, a kid! Out strolling here in the wilderness!

replies.text: N

message: Should you really be out here kid? These areas are dangerous.

replies.text: I can handle myself
Why? What is out here?
You are right, I better leave

message: I bet you can.

replies.text: N

message: Well, west of here is not much. No towns for quite a while, only the harsh and dangerous wilderness.

replies.text: N

message: Of course, there is Carn Tower if you travel really far west, but you really do not want to head there.

replies.text: N

message: So, what brings you to these parts of the land?

replies.text: I am looking for a group of men led by someone by the name of Rogorn. Are you him?
Just looking for any treasure that might reveal itself here.
I am just exploring.

message: Well, keep on looking then.
That depends, why do you want to know?

replies.text: You are wanted by the Feygard patrol for the crimes you have committed.
I am seeking to deal justice wherever I can, and I heard that you are in need of being shown some justice.
I am sent by some guards over at the Crossroads guardhouse to look for you.
The guards from Feygard are looking for you, and I came to warn you.

message: Hah! We? Crimes?

replies.text: N

message: Justice? What would you know of justice, kid?

replies.text: N

message: If there is someone that deserves punishment, it surely isn't us. By the Shadow, it's those snobs from Feygard that should be taught a lesson.

replies.text: I will not listen to your lies! For Feygard!
Talk all you want, I happen to know that you have stolen from Feygard, which is not acceptable.
What's your side of the story then?

message: I tell you, we did not steal anything from those snobs.

replies.text: You are still wanted dead by the Feygard patrol. For Feygard!
Why are they looking for you then?

message: I had hoped it would not come to this. For the Shadow!

replies.text: Let's fight!

message: Talked to those guards from Feygard eh? Tell me, what is your opinion of Feygard?

replies.text: They seem to have honorable ideals of law and order, and I respect that.
Their ideals seem to be a bit oppressive of the people, which I do not like.
I have no opinion, I try not to get involved in their business.
I have no idea.

message: Interesting. But now that you are part of their business by coming here to look for me on their behalf, how does that fit into your unwillingness to take sides?

replies.text: I will not listen to your lies! For Feygard!
I was told that you have stolen from Feygard, which is not acceptable.
I want to hear your side of the story.
I am just looking to see if there is some treasure to be gained from this.
I have no idea.

message: You should make up your mind about what your priorities are. Tell your Feygard friends that we will not be oppressed by them. Shadow be with you, child.
You have got that right. They are always trying to make life hard for us little people. Let me tell you my side of the story.

replies.text: N

message: Law and order? What use do we have of that if we are always persecuted by them and do not even have the freedom to live our lives the way we want?

replies.text: N

message: They are always looking for us, trying to oppress us in some way. Always trying to make our lives a little bit harder.

replies.text: N

message: Good to hear that there still are some people willing to make a stand against Feygard. Let me tell you my side of the story.

replies.text: N

message: Me and my boys here travelled from our home in Nor City to these northern lands a few days ago.

replies.text: N

message: We had never been here ourselves. We had only heard stories about how tough the guards from Feygard were, and how they held their precious law above all.

replies.text: N

message: Anyway, we got wind of a certain business opportunity here up north. One where we would be on the receiving end of a very profitable deal.

replies.text: N

message: So we went here to conduct our business. Shortly thereafter, I guess the guards from Feygard must have been tipped off about us, since we noticed that we were being followed by the guards after a while.

replies.text: N

message: Not willing to risk anything, considering the rumors we had heard about the guards from there, we did the only reasonable thing we could do - we abandoned the plan right away and left, before we could conduct the business we had planned.

replies.text: N

message: However, something must have upset the guards there anyway. Now we hear that we are accused of murder and theft in Feygard, without even being there ourselves.

replies.text: What was your business there?
I will not listen to your lies! For Feygard!
Your story does not add up.
I believe your story. How can I help you?

message: I can't really say. We do our business on behalf of Nor City, and our business is our own.

replies.text: I will not listen to your lies! For Feygard!
Your story does not add up.
I believe your story. How can I help you?

message: What are you, a spy for Feygard? I told you, the accusations against us are false.

replies.text: N

message: Thank you for listening to our side of the story.

replies.text: What now? I was sent here to find you by some guards in the Crossroads guardhouse.

message: You tell those guards that you searched for us, but did not find anyone.

replies.text: Will do. Goodbye.

message: You are back.

replies.text: Can you tell me your side of the story again?
I will not listen to your lies! You must be held accountable for your crimes against Feygard!
I believe your story. How can I help you?

message: Thank you for listening to our side of the story.
